reviews.text: The Olympic Park does not seem like it is used much but it is good for a walkthrough to appreciate the architecture and see where history happened. There are also some nice gardens nearby and some great views of the area.
Nice evening walk all the way down from place d'España. Too bad that, like allmost all olympic arena's, it's not used very often. But after 25 years it still looks ok.

Sat on the grass in the Placa d'Europe at the end of this area and had a picnic in the shade of the upright poles and had to keep moving as the shadow moved with the sun which was interesting to see how much it moved. Has an interesting fountain and we were trying to work out the significance of the connection between the famous names on the wall.
A walking area placed in Anella Olimpica,The Olympic Ring.Nothing special,a walking path bounded by some columns.But there's an impressive communications tower designed by Santiago Calatrava.

We hopped off here as part of our hop on hop off bus tour. Spent about thirty minutes here which was enough time to recall our memories of the 1992 Olympics. Bonus was it was free to enter and take some photographs.  There was some sports set up on the field for interactive participation in a grand stadium. Not sure if you had to pay for those or not. Worth a stop here.
liked the architecture and views here, very clean and well kept area, easy to get to. go and enjoy! you can take some cool pics

the architecture reminds me of old roman/Greek ruins. and then there is this big structure that looks like a space weapon! the view over the city is also very nice. 
the whole area is well worth a visit!
its very nice to touch the sport history of Barcelona! its very monumental sculpture! visit Olympic museum to feel more!

Beautiful Olympic Park, a pleasant place to walk.
Located on the hill, you can see beautiful views from there.

The Galeria Olimpica is a lovely museum/ area at the top of the Montjuic Hill. Behind the MNAC museum and beside the Anella Olympica, it is a lovely place. . Worth a quick visit as part of your itinerary to visit Montjuic.

You can walk from here to Barcelonetta beach with tourists all over the world, happy people, take a swim. But please do NOT drink the "mohitos" on the beach , since the drinks and the food is made by Indian imigrants on the beach from dirty plastic containers, I took pictures. All the rest is goergeous about the Barcelona.
